Manuel Bonilla

 

Professional

I graduated from Polytechnic University of Aguascalientes with a B.Eng. in Mechatronics. I received the M.S. in Robotics and Advanced Manufacturing from CINVESTAV under the supervision of the professors Vicente Parra and Fransico Ruiz. Since 2012 I am with the Robotics and Automation group of Research Center E Piaggio of the Engineering School Leonardo da Vinci at University of Pisa where I am currently working toward the Ph.D degree. My Advisor is the professor Antonio Bicchi and my main research topic is constrained motion planning and execution for soft robots.
Before starting my master studies I was working first as a Technical Support Engineer in Trucka, and then in Gp Electromecanica as an Automation Engineer. Once I got my M.S. degree I worked for the technology center of Whirlpool Corporation as Engineer analyst, my job was to perform Multibody Dinamic Simulations. After these experience on industry I decided to follow one of my dreams and try to become a Ph.D. I am in the way.

Publications

  • M. Bonilla, E. Farnioli, L. Pallottino and A. Bicchi. Sample-Based Motion Planning for Robot Manipulators with Closed Kinematic Chains, in 2015 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation, Seattle, USA, May 26 - 31, Accepted for Publication.
  • M. Bonilla, E. Farnioli, M. G. Catalano, G. Grioli, M. Garabini, M. Gabiccini and A. Bicchi. Grasping with Soft Hands, in IEEE-RAS 2014 International Conference on Humanoid Robots, Madrid, Spain, November 18 - 20, In Press.
  • N. Vaskevicius, C. Atanas, M. Bonilla, V. Tincani, T. Stoyanov, G. Fantoni, K. Pathak, A. J. Lilienthal, A. Bicchi and A. Birk. Object Recognition and Localization for Robust Grasping with a Dexterous Gripper in the Context of Container Unloading. 2014 IEEE International Conference on Automation Science and Engineering.
  • R. Krug, T. Stoyanov, M. Bonilla,V. Tincani, N. Vaskeviciusz, G. Fantoni, A. Birkz, A. Lilienthal and A. Bicchi. Velvet Fingers: Grasp Planning and Execution for an Underactuated Gripper with Active Surfaces, in 2014 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Automation, Hong Kong, May 31 2014-June 7 2014, 2014
  • V. Tincani, G. Grioli, M. G. Catalano, M. Bonilla, M. Garabini, G. Fantoni and A. Bicchi. Controlling the active surfaces of the Velvet Fingers: sticky to slippy fingers, in IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems, IROS 2013, Tokyo, Japan, 2013, pp. 5494 - 5499
  • E. Farnioli, M. Gabiccini, M. Bonilla and A. Bicchi. Grasp Compliance Regulation in Synergistically Controlled Robotic Hands with VSA, in IEEE/RSJ International Conference on Intelligent Robots and Systems, IROS 2013, Tokyo, Japan, 2013, pp. 3015 -3022
  • M. Bonilla, V. Parra-Vega, F. J. Ruiz-Sanchez. H^2IL Co-simulation of Cooperative Robots based on ADAMS, MATLAB and a haptic interface, National Congress of the Automatic Control Mexican Association, celebrated on Puerto Vallarta, Jalisco. México, October 2010

Personal

My full name is José Manuel Bonilla Jiménez, I was born in Aguascalientes, Mexico in 1985. I am married to Vanessa Sánchez whom I have three children with: Vanessa is 10 years old, Paulette is 8 years old and Manuel is 2 years old.
I grew up in Aguascalientes, in 2011 I moved to Saltillo to continue my studies and 2 years later to Monterrey to work. Now I am living in Pisa where I'm currently pursuing a PhD in Robotics.

Hobbies

I like dancing, I love Mexican regional music, tequila and spicy food. I like playing soccer, I support the best soccer team in Mexico which is the Club America.
When I have some free time from work and family I like reading. I also like traveling.
